previewDescription: Online platform for communication between stylists and designers
title: How Chillicode «married» and merged an imagery startup and a wedding dresses wholesale
body:
Pullquest is an LA startup, an online platform where designers can show their conceptual looks while stylists can choose something for their celebrity customers events from an ordinary photo session till Grammy and Oscar Awards Ceremonies.

It is a win-win case — the stylists can save their time, energy and money whether the designers can get more business opportunities and pull the items online. 
The New York Bridal Council asked Pullquest to host autumn bridal fashion week on their platform because of the pandemic restrictions in the USA. The Pullquest existing functionality was not enough and they had to make a deep refactoring of the code and add some improvements. 

#### What was done: 
- the architecture to create portals with different design and without any backend changes;
- a virtual event portal;
- a landing page for exclusive elite invitations; 
- various possibilities for different roles;
- a chat;
- automatic notifications (how to create and send them);
- bulk purchase function;
- individual profile links;
- an opportunity to make your profile public; 
- designer profile expansion;
- designer invites with simplified registration for the stylists.

#### Our target:
1. Actually they needed a separate event portal connected to Pullquest for sure, otherwise what is the point. A portal with restricted exclusive access. At the same time Pullquest itself should operate as usual without any issue.
2. To create a landing page on Pullquest platform with an event announcement.
3. The Bridal Council is organising this event to present new models to the wholesalers. In this case the wholesale function has to be added too.
4. Normally such events offline are more like coming outs and networking is an important part there, it was obvious the portal needed a chat.

#### Our solutions:
1. Frankly speaking, we had only 5 weeks. To develop a new web portal and meet this deadline was just impossible. But an impossible task becomes challenging and that is why it is much more attractive.

   We decided not to separate the existing system into two different projects but simply scale it. Spoiler: now Pullquest is able to host similar or not very similar events with a minimal preparation. No need to change anything in the backend whereas the design and partially frontend can have significant changes.

   We got it with the help of a flexible system called Elasticsearch. Its smart search helped us to separate the data between two platforms with minimal effort. Its flexible search engine let us add new search criteria and filter data with a high speed.

2. Within the Bridal Council brand book on Pullquest platform we have created a landing page where the main focus is on the countdown. It looks like a joke, but actually it is not a standard landing page with a timer showing the end of sales. In our case it is a notification of the event coming soon.

   You could also pass the registration on this page to get exclusive access. In the admin you just had to put a tick in the new check box to easily distribute accesses to a standard and an exclusive portal.

   A designer could send an invite with a simplified registration to a stylist. The designer could open his settings and generate the link valid for 7 days. A new person opens the link and completes the registration after that he can use all the benefits of Pullquest service. Ordinary process can take from 2 hours to 2 days because of manual moderation.![invite.png](/assets/uploads/invite_d5314a8551.png)

3. To add buying and selling wholesale dresses function we inserted different user roles, their easy and fast administration, as well as statistics on views and orders.![report.png](/assets/uploads/report_8db1ad13b5.png)

   In the admin panel we have placed a flexible user editor that contains all the user data (remember! the people are not random and we know quite a lot about them). Then we have also created a possibility to hide, block, reactivate a user, assign multiple roles to a single user at a time.![admin2.png](/assets/uploads/admin2_b70e9e7e84.png)

   Every designer could create a personal link for his account instead of using standard digital ID.![profile-settings.png](/assets/uploads/profile_settings_e0290bc339.png)

   Now the designers can choose by themselves whether we are going to sell their goods in bulk or they can keep on providing clothes for image purposes as it used to be on Pullquest.

   For the trading purposes we have set up:
   - a size table with a price calculator;
   - a trash folder and payment via Stripe;
   - email notifications to be created and sent depending on the interaction between the stylists and designers;
   - reports to be created according to the view and order number.

4. We had to apply the websocket protocol to create the chat for sending messages, attachments and links in the real time.![chat.mp4](/assets/uploads/chat_f21166b035.mp4)![red-spot.png](/assets/uploads/red_spot_28fb377c81.png)

   A red dot sight means that there were new messages and after a while there was a notification sent to your email to remind you about unread messages.

5. We expanded a designer profile page. A designer profile page used to look like this:![profile-before.png](/assets/uploads/profile_before_a0b9af5984.png)

   Our feature let us make a full profile like in the social media sites.![profile-after.png](/assets/uploads/profile_after_889973c17b.png)

   We helped to make their profiles public. When a profile page got its new nice look,the users started to share it with many people. Definitely the functionality for unregistered users is very limited, that is one more reason to register and join a fast-growing Pullquest community.

#### Our results:
- Designer reports allowed them to determine the demand level and the interest towards their products. These reports have already become an integral part of the classical Pullquest. During the event we got a request to double the number of available reports. Every other designer uses this function.
- During the Fashion Week wholesale trade was so successful so we kept it on the portal and now it is getting more popular and adding new features.
- The project itself was brilliant and the New York Times Magazine posted an article about it. Although our company name was not mentioned in the text, we know who did it all.
